bibl.title: State of Nebraska DEPARTMENT OF INSURANCE. Summary of Insurance Business in Nebraska for the year 1938

p.seg: State of Nebraska DEPARTMENT OF INSURANCE Summary of Insurance Business in Nebraska for the year 1938 Also Comparative Figures of Authorized Companies for the years 1935. 193(6, 1937.

To His Excellency, Governor R. L. Cochran: We respectfully submit the summary of business of companies authorized to write insurance m this State for the year ending December 31, 1938. DEPARTMENT OF INSURANCE, C. SMRHA, Director.

Light face figures m respective State indicates Nebraska Companies writing m that state. Bold face figures m respective State indicates Companies domiciled m that State writing m Nebraska. Where but one figure appears indicates Nebraska Companies writing m that State. 27 Nebraska Companies write m other States.

NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT COMPANIES REINSURING, MERGING, OB WITHDRAWING FROM JANUARY 1, 1988 TO JUNE 1, 1030 Allemannia Fire Insurance Company of Pittsburg, Pittsburgh, Pa., with - drew as of April 30, 1939. American Annuity Assurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska, reinsured by Republic National Life Insurance Company, Dallas, Texas, June 1, 1938. American Travelers Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska. Inactive. Bankers National Life Insurance Company, Montclalr, New Jersey, withdrew as of April 30, 1939. Builders & Manufacturers Casualty Company, Chicago, Illinois, license revoked March 31, 1938, because of insolvency and placed in re - ceivership by the Illinois State Insurance Department. Cosmopolitan Old Line Life Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, reinsured by Lincoln Liberty Life Insurance Company, Lincoln, Ne - braska, effective by Court Order March 1, 1938. Farmers Co-operative Hail Insurance Company of Nebraska, Grand Island, Nebraska, ceased operations in 1935. Farmers & Merchants Mutual Insurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska. Corporation dissolved May 14, 1938. Farmers Mutual Fire and Lightning Insurance Company of Burt County, Tekamah, Nebraska, started liquidating in 19 37. Farmers Mutual Insurance Company of Hamilton County, Aurora, Nebraska, ceased business in January, 1937, and filed certificate of dissolution February 13, 1939. First American Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, started liquidat - ing in 1938. First Reinsurance Company of Hartford, Hartford, Connecticut, with - drew as of January 1, 1939. Guaranty Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, ceased operations in 1937. Hercules Life Insurance Company, Chicago, Illinois, merged with the Washington National Insurance Company, Chicago, Illinois, May 31, 1938. Imperial Assurance Company, New York, N. Y., withdrew as of De - cember 31, 1938. Merchants and Manufacturers Fire Insurance Company, New York, N. Y., merged with Importers and Exporters Insurance Company, New York, N. Y. and changed name to Merchants and Manufacturers Insurance Company of New York, New York City, December 12, 1938. National Thift Assurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska, reinsured by Republic National Life Insurance Company, Dallas, Texas, June 1, 1938. ' Nebraska Hail Insurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska, ceased operations in 1936. Pawnee County Mutual Insurance Company, Pawnee City, Nebraska, reinsured by Farmers Union Co-operative Insurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska, April 3, 1939. Postal Indemnity Company, Dallas, Texas, withdrew as of April 30, 1938. Reliance Life Insurance Company of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, Pa., with - drew as of May 31, 1938.

NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT Republic Underwriters, Waco, Texas, placed in receivership March 31, 1938. Union Marine & General Insurance Company, Ltd. (Liverpool, Eng.) New York, N. Y., withdrew as of April 30, 1938. United Crop Growers Hail Insurance Company, Grand Island, Ne - ■' braska, ceased operations in 1934. Western Union Life Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, reinsured by Republic National Life Insurance Company, Dallas, Texas, May 17, 1938. Wheat Belt Hail Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, ceased op - erations in 1935. Wilcox Farmers Mutual Fire and Lightning Insurance Company, Wilcox, Nebraska, reinsured by Farmers Mutual Insurance Company of Nebraska, Lincoln, Nebraska, March 4. 1938.

NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT COMPANIES CHANGING NAME OR PLAN FROM JANUARY 1, 1038 TO JUNE 1, 1039 Central Fire Insurance Company of Baltimore, Maryland, changed name to Central Insurance Company of Baltimore, February 10, 1938. Central Health Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, changed name to Wood - men Central Health Company and plan from assessment health and accident to mutual legal reserve casualty, January 27, 1938. Columbia Insurance Company, Jersey City, New Jersey, changed name to Columbia Insurance Company of New York, and reincorporated as a New York corporation, April 4, 1939. Dwelling House Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, changed name to Standard Reliance Insurance Company, January 30, 1939. Great American Health and Accident Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, changed name to American Protective Health and Accident Com - pany, February 14, 1939. Hardware Mutual Fire Insurance Company of Minnesota, Minneapolis,. Minnesota, changed name to Hardware Mutual Insurance Company of Minnesota, April 21, 1938. Lutheran Mutual Life Insurance Company, Waverly, Iowa, changed plan from fraternal beneficiary to mutual legal reserve life and name from Lutheran Mutual Aid Society to Lutheran Mutual Life Insur - ance Company, January 1, 1938. National Security Fire Insurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska, changed name to National Security Insurance Company, February 24, 19 38. Saint Paul-Mercury Indemnity Company of Saint Paul, Wilmington, Delaware, changed name to Saint Paul-Mercury Indemnity Com - . pany, January 23, 1939. Yeoman Mutual Life Insurance Company, Des Moines, Iowa, changed name to American Mutual Life Insurance Company, July 1, 1938.
